URL: Comment 4 Ishrat files exposed by TIMES NOW forced former Home Minister P Chidambaram to respond. From the 'no approval' statement to the 'I presume I did' statement, his U-turn has come after 9 days. In a series of tweets, P Chidambaram tried to shift the blame to then Under Secretary RVS Mani. Former Under Secretary Mani speaking with dismissed Chidambaram's claims.Facing fire from BJP for alleged "flip-flop" on Ishrat Jahan case, former Home Minister P Chidambaram today (April 26) hit back saying the affidavit controversy is only to "divert attention" from the real issue, which is whether it was a "fake" encounter or not. Regarding the controversy surrounding the change in affidavits done during his tenure, the senior Congress leader said,"Coming to the affidavits, the Home Minister does not sign affidavits. It is signed by an Under Secretary."
